dashboard.program

Class DashboardProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • javax.swing.JApplet
              • acm.program.Program
                • acm.program.GraphicsProgram
                  • dashboard.program.DashboardProgram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    acm.io.IOModel, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer

    public abstract class DashboardProgram
extends acm.program.GraphicsProgram
    Implements a subclass of GraphicsProgram with specialized methods for drawing dashboards.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBackground(double spacing, java.awt.Color baseColor)
      Draws a background behind the entire dashboard based on the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen.
      void addCommandOutput(java.lang.String key, StringUpdatable commandOutput)
      Designates a StringUpdatable as a command output, which will print out command hierarchies in real time.
      void addWidget(java.lang.String key, acm.graphics.GObject widget)
      Adds the specified widget to the DashboardProgram's widget roster and draws it on the canvas

      Adds the specified widget to the DashboardProgram's widget roster and draws it on the canvas at the specified (x, y) coordinates

      Adds the specified widget to the DashboardProgram's widget roster and draws it on the canvas at the specified point

      Returns the widget associated with the specified key.

      Returns the left x-coordinate of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen.

      Returns the top y-coordinate of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen.

      Handles the mousePressed event, transmits the MouseEvent to any underlying subwidgets, and updates all command outputs with the command hierarchy.

      Handles the mouseReleased event, transmits the MouseEvent to any underlying subwidgets, and updates all command outputs with the command hierarchy.

      Removes the background (if any) from behind the dashboard.

                            acm.graphics.GObject widget)
        Adds the specified widget to the DashboardProgram's widget roster and draws it on the canvas
        Parameters:

        widget - the widget to be added

                            acm.graphics.GObject widget,
                            double x,

        Parameters:

        widget - the widget to be added
        x - the x-coordinate of the widget
        y - the y-coordinate of the widget

      • addWidget

        public final void addWidget(java.lang.String key,
                            acm.graphics.GObject widget,
                            acm.graphics.GPoint pt)
        Adds the specified widget to the DashboardProgram's widget roster and draws it on the canvas at the specified point
        Parameters:
        key - a handle that refers to the widget
        widget - the widget to be added
        pt - a point corresponding to the widget's location

      • removeWidget

        public final void removeWidget(java.lang.String key)
        Removes the widget associated with the specified key from the DashboardProgram's widget roster and the canvas. If the widget could not be located, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that is bound to the widget

      • getWidget

        public final acm.graphics.GObject getWidget(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the widget associated with the specified key. If the widget could not be located, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that is bound to the widget
        Returns:
        the widget associated with the specified key

      • getTotalWidgetWidth

        public final double getTotalWidgetWidth()
        Returns the width of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen. The widgets must have been added using addWidget (as opposed to add) in order for them to contribute to the total widget width.
        Returns:
        the width of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen

      • getTotalWidgetHeight

        public final double getTotalWidgetHeight()
        Returns the height of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen. The widgets must have been added using addWidget (as opposed to add) in order for them to contribute to the total widget height.
        Returns:
        the height of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles the mousePressed event, transmits the MouseEvent to any underlying subwidgets, and updates all command outputs with the command hierarchy.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class acm.program.Program

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Handles the mouseReleased event, transmits the MouseEvent to any underlying subwidgets, and updates all command outputs with the command hierarchy.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class acm.program.Program

      • getWidgetLeftX

        public double getWidgetLeftX()
        Returns the left x-coordinate of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen.
        Returns:
        the left x-coordinate of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen

        public double getWidgetTopY()
        Returns the top y-coordinate of the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen.
        Returns:

      • addCommandOutput

        public final void addCommandOutput(java.lang.String key,
                                   StringUpdatable commandOutput)
        Designates a StringUpdatable as a command output, which will print out command hierarchies in real time.
        Parameters:
        key - a handle that refers to the command output
        commandOutput - the command output to add

      • removeCommandOutput

        public final void removeCommandOutput(java.lang.String key)
        Frees and stops a StringUpdatable from receiving command hierarchies.
        Parameters:
        key - the key that is bound to the widget

      • addBackground

        public final void addBackground(double spacing,
                                java.awt.Color baseColor)
        Draws a background behind the entire dashboard based on the bounding box surrounding all widgets on screen. This method should be called after all widgets have been added, as the background does not automatically resize.
        Parameters:
        spacing - the amount of space between each edge of the bounding box and the background
        baseColor - the color of the background

      • removeBackground

        public final void removeBackground()
        Removes the background (if any) from behind the dashboard.
